channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Trump gives TikTok deal with Oracle and Walmart his blessing
item.description: Donald Trump on Saturday said he had approved a deal for Oracle and Walmart to buy TikTok, potentially averting a shutdown of the app in the United States. China must now approve the deal.

item.title: DAN HODGES: Why Dishy Rishi is turning into Ruthless Rishi, the Iron Chancellor
item.description: DAN HODGES: Dishy Rishi is about to be put on furlough. As Covid threatens to plunge Britain into a double-dip lockdown, Sunak is only too aware he cannot turn off the spending taps.

item.title: Village that declared war on flytippers - and won!
item.description: In Barston the villagers are fighting back against fly-tipping, with round-the-clock vigils and a £40,000 network of motion-activated CCTV surveillance cameras.

item.title: Heartbroken family of disabled man, 18, turned up to hospital to be told he had died
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Devastated father Darren Hudson says he is desperately seeking answers after his son Ollie, 18, died alone mysteriously during the coronavirus lockdown in April.

item.title: British billionaire Lord Alan Sugar and his wife AVOID hotel quarantine after arriving in Sydney
item.description: British billionaire Lord Alan Sugar and his wife Ann Simons were given special treatment upon their arrival in Australia on Thursday.

item.title: Boris Johnson unveils huge penalty for those breaking self-isolation rules
item.description: Covid sufferers could be fined up to £10,000 if they leave their house when they are meant to be self-isolating under draconian new rules being introduced by Boris Johnson.

item.title: Wetherspoons boss warns new Covid restrictions would be 'devastating' for pubs and restaurants
item.description: Ministers are considering new measures, including a temporary second lockdown to try and stop Covid transmission. The move could lead to pubs being ordered to close or face a 10pm curfew.

item.title: Caroline Flack 'gave Lewis Burton £25K to pay off debts' just like Lottie Tomlinson
item.description: The late TV presenter, 40, who died in February, allegedly handed the model the cash during their relationship and also paid for rent and food.

item.title: Coronation Street star Shobna Gulati opens up about her mother's dementia in 'Do You Remember Me?'
item.description: British actress Shobna Gularti explained how she cared for her mother Asha Gulati during her battle with dementia from 2016 to her death in 2019, aged 79.

item.title: Elizabeth Warren leads hundreds in chants during candlelit vigil for Ruth Bader Ginsburg
item.description: Elizabeth Warren on Saturday night led tributes to Ruth Bader Ginsberg from the steps of the Supreme Court, as hundreds gathered in Washington DC to honor the late justice.

item.title: Oxford scientists: the only 'circuit break' we need is from this cycle of bad data and bad science
item.description: Oxford University scientists said Boris Johnson and his advisers are making 'catastrophic and wildly over-the-top' decisions about containing Covid as they talk about a 'circuit breaker'.

item.title: Fitness coach Anjuli Mack, 26, shares bikini photos taken seconds apart to blast beauty standards
item.description: Auckland fitness coach Anjuli Mack looks dramatically different in these two photos - but the reason is not what you might expect.

item.title: BEN BRADLEY: Why I refuse to take part in 're-education' that tells ordinary people they are racists
item.description: BEN BRADLEY: Soon, all MPs, including me, will be asked to undertake Unconscious Bias training - the second phase of our re-education following a summer of 'Valuing Everybody' lessons.

item.title: PETER HITCHENS: Can't we put the Johnson Junta in a nice rest home?
item.description: PETER HITCHENS: Most people have far too readily accepted limits to their lives which the world's tyrannies would once have hesitated to impose on their citizens. Well, have you had enough yet?

item.title: Boris Johnson's allies angered by 'brutal and personal' attack on the PM
item.description: A deeply unflattering portrait suggested that the combination of his own brush with death, dealing with the pandemic and personal financial concerns had taken a terrible toll on the PM.

item.title: Alesha Dixon makes a statement in a Black Lives Matter necklace
item.description: Alesha Dixon, 41, has made a statement in a Black Lives Matter necklace after ITV shows support for Diversity with full-page adverts after Ofcom complaints reach 24,500.

item.title: Trump's frontrunners for the Supreme Court nomination are a devout Catholic and Cuban-American judge
item.description: Amy Coney Barrett, 48, and Barbara Lagoa, 52, are the front runners for Trump's Supreme Court nomination.

item.title: Senior Tories plot 'Parliamentary lock' to subject Covid emergency measures to a vote by MPs
item.description: Sir Graham Brady (pictured) is looking to force a vote by MPs on emergency coronavirus measures amid concerns that restrictions on the public's freedom are being imposed without debate.

item.title: White working-class children are UK's most deprived pupils MPs warned
item.description: White working-class children are being left behind by the school system, face a lifetime of economic disadvantage and will be hit hardest by the coronavirus crisis, new research reveals.

item.title: Covid tests chaos is blamed on 'mad' frenzy by parents to get checks done on children
item.description: Typically, coughs and colds spike every September when children head back to class, and become even more common during the winter.

item.title: Whitehall's army of 180 diversity watchdogs
item.description: Whitehall mandarins have been criticised for wasting money on 'non-jobs' after it was revealed that at least 180 diversity officers are on the payroll across nine Government departments.

item.title: Four people rushed to hospital with serious injuries after 'multiple stabbing' attack in Plymouth
item.description: Officers attended the scene on Albert Road, Plymouth, at 10pm on Saturday with reports of multiple stabbings.

item.title: Victory for Kate Middleton as society bible Tatler caves
item.description: Tatler has cut huge swathes from its online profile of the Duchess of Cambridge after the society bible was accused of publishing a 'string of lies'.

item.title: Britons sink a few drinks while making the most of 70F sun with warm weather to last until Tuesday
item.description: Highs of 77F (25C) were recorded at Heathrow today, as Britons flocked out to enjoy the last of the summer weather before rain showers are due to hit the UK early next week.

item.title: Britain faces on-off lockdowns for next SIX MONTHS as scientists recommend strict new measures
item.description: The PM is looking at ditching his Rule of Six, which outlawed social gatherings of seven or more people in England, and introducing fortnight-long 'circuit breakers'.

item.title: Rishi Sunak faces backlash from retail giants over plans to axe tax-free shopping
item.description: Rishi Sunak is facing a backlash from retail giants including Selfridges, Harrods and Marks & Spencer over 'catastrophic' plans to axe tax-free shopping for tourists.

item.title: Queen's gamekeeper is injured after being pelted with stones by illegal hare coursers
item.description: A Royal gamekeeper was pelted with stones after attempting to stop illegal hare coursing on the Queen's estate. He confronted three men who were hunting hares with dogs at Flitcham, Norfolk.

item.title: Bystanders run for cover as gunman strikes in triple shooting outside a Coventry Chinese takeaway
item.description: The CCTV footage was recorded near Coventry, West Midlands, as the suspect opened fire on Thursday night in the attack that saw three people admitted to hospital.

item.title: Look out Holly and Phil! BBC to launch rival to This Morning
item.description: Daytime television is set for a ratings war after the BBC announced the November launch of a rival to ITV's award-winning This Morning show, The Mail on Sunday can reveal.

item.title: A second national lockdown would put a million jobs at risk, warn hospitality chiefs
item.description: The bosses of some of Britain's best-known restaurants and bars last night warned a second national lockdown would devastate the industry and lead to a million more job losses.

item.title: Birmingham park visitor in critical condition in hospital after being found in lake
item.description: A woman is in hospital in critical condition after she was pulled from a pool at Pype Hayes Park in Birmingham today. Emergency services rushed to the scene earlier this afternoon.

item.title: Labour peer Baroness Joan Bakewell reveals she was sexually assaulted early in her career
item.description: Baroness Joan Bakewell, 87, has revealed that a junior minister, who has since died, had to be 'fended off' after he made a grab for her early in her career as a broadcaster.

item.title: Coronavirus: Ministers fear Chris Whitty will quit if he doesn't get his way on lockdown
item.description: Ministers were accused of being 'in the grip' of Chief Medical Officer Professor Chris Whitty amid concerns he could resign and speak out if his tough lockdown measures are ignored.

item.title: Parliamentary staff write poems about their privilege after Black Lives Matter protests
item.description: Parliamentary staff have reportedly been given an 'inclusivity toolkit' and are urged to admit their 'privilege' and give their 'support' to BAME colleagues through an online platform.

item.title: Eagle-eyed James Herriot viewers spo­­t mistakes in the remake of All Creatures Great And Small
item.description: Eagle-eyed viewers of Channel 5's remake of TV classic All Creatures Great And Small have noticed it contains a number of irritating inconsistencies and blunders.

item.title: Sasha Swire isn't afraid to hurt people's feelings writes CRAIG BROWN
item.description: CRAIG BROWN: After two decades of being expected to grin and bear it, Sasha Swire has had her revenge.

item.title: Boris Johnson backs MoS campaign to end lone births scandal
item.description: Nearly half of hospital Trusts continue to ban partners from attending either labour or scans, or both, because of draconian Covid-19 rules.

item.title: GEORGE WALDEN on the biggest scandal in Sasha Swire's political diary
item.description: GEORGE WALDEN: We all have chums we collect and keep up with, from school, university or work, but the 'chumocracy' gathered round the former PM in Downing Street was something different.

item.title: SARAH VINE: Kill Whitey 'joke' cracked comedian Sophie Duker puts the BBC in the last chance saloon
item.description: SARAH VINE: It's been quite a week for the BBC, even by its own shambolic standards. Published accounts showed staff pay has soared to £1.5 billion.

item.title: Former Cabinet Minister and TV presenter Esther McVey marries fellow Tory MP Philip Davies
item.description: Marrying during the pandemic came at a price, as the couple, who have been dating for five years, had to uninvite dozens of guests to meet Covid rules limiting wedding parties to 30.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: The Crown actress Emma Corrin captures the charitable spirit of Princess Diana
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: She will star as Princess Diana in the next series of TV series The Crown and Emma Corrin is embracing the charitable spirit of the late princess.

item.title: David Mellor: It's time to stand up to this virus like our parents and grandparents would have done
item.description: We will be asked not to mix with other households, despite the loneliness and misery that enforced isolation causes or face arrest. That's not how we faced illness in the past, David Mellor writes.

item.title: Give NHS heroes the George Cross, says LORD ASHCROFT
item.description: LORD ASHCROFT: I hope that the staff of the NHS might soon become the next collective award of the GC for their bravery in tackling the coronavirus pandemic

item.title: Furious Tory activists accuse Sasha Swire of 'betraying friends' with her tell-all political memoir
item.description: Lady Swire, 57, sent her diaries to a publisher last year after her husband retired as East Devon MP.

item.title: Hard-Left tells Sir Keir Starmer to stick to Jeremy Corbyn's policies
item.description: At an online rally for the Socialist Campaign Group on Monday, party figures loyal to the Left-wing agenda charted by the former leader will warn Sir Keir not to 'lurch to the Right'.

item.title: Britons are ALREADY looking for frozen turkeys and Christmas trees as they yearn for festivities
item.description: Sainsbury's group e-commerce director Nigel Blunt said interest in festive ranges is normally small in September, but he said last week there were 400 searches for 'whole frozen turkeys'

item.title: US envoy rejects threat from Joe Biden that Boris Johnson's Brexit bill could harm trade deal
item.description: US ambassador Woody Johnson says the US 'stands committed' to the UK in his first intervention over the contentious Internal Market Bill.

item.title: Dishy Rishi gets tough: Chancellor plans to FREEZE benefits and state pay
item.description: With unemployment projected to rise to more than four million as a result of the crisis, the Chancellor has told fellow Ministers that he is deeply concerned about long-term damage.

item.title: Soho's iconic Ronnie Scott's Jazz Club reopens in style
item.description: The Soho-based club opened its doors with a reduced capacity of 50 per cent and with strict social distancing measures in place.

item.title: Delivered with your pint of milk… washing-up liquid in a glass bottle
item.description: A growing demand for eco-friendly products means record numbers of Britons are ordering cleaning products straight to their homes, including washing-up liquid in glass bottles.

item.title: Second wave of Covid cases in Europe is not causing deaths to spike
item.description: The difference may be explained by an increase in testing in the countries in recent months, but could also be a sign that the virus is mainly infecting younger, healthier people who survive the illness.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Gordon Ramsay's new nightmare
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Diners have been scathing in their criticism about the small portions served up at Gordon Ramsay's York & Albany restaurant.

item.title: Viewers slam Dennis Nilsen serial killer drama over smoking
item.description: Both David Tennant, who played the mass murderer, and Daniel Mays, as the detective who snared him, were rarely seen without a lit cigarette in their hands.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Mamma Mia! star Dominic Cooper falls foul of car thieves
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: I'm saddened to report that Mamma Mia! star Dominic Cooper has fallen foul of car thieves once again.

item.title: TALK OF THE TOWN: Billie Piper's tip for reaching the top? Be boring!
item.description: TALK OF THE TOWN: Billie Piper may have earned a reputation during her younger days but she reckons the only way to get ahead in showbiz is to be boring.

item.title: Anti-mask mayhem in Trafalgar Square: Conspiracy theorists clash with police
item.description: More than 30 have been arrested after Metropolitan Police officers moved in on angry demonstrators defying coronavirus laws as they descended upon Nelson's column in central London in their droves.

item.title: Britain's woodlands face a deer invasion as lockdown lessens the demand for wild venison
item.description: Cheaper, farmed imports from New Zealand, Spain and Portugal had already lowered demand for wild venison but the lockdown of restaurants, hotels and cruise ships essentially closed the market.

item.title: University debating society 'disinvited' author opposed to gay marriage - only to then re-invite her
item.description: Journalist and activist Caroline Farrow had been invited to a freshers' week Zoom debate by the University of Exeter to oppose the motion of 'sex work is real work'.

item.title: How one pregnant MP is fighting to stop the trauma of lone births caused by Covid rules
item.description: Of all the messages about lone births that flooded her inbox this week, it was the one from a father that stopped the campaigning Tory MP Alicia Kearns in her tracks.

item.title: Book reveals Prince Philip's complicated relationship with Charles
item.description: In a landmark biography of Prince Philip, a distinguished Royal writer paints a compelling portrait of the Queen's rock-steady companion as he nears his 100th birthday.

item.title: We're already treating the casualties of electric scooters, says top neurosurgeon CHRISTOPHER UFF
item.description: CHRISTOPHER UFF: E-scooters are responsible for a growing number of serious injuries to both riders and pedestrians brought into the Royal London Hospital, where I work.

item.title: Queen Letizia of Spain stuns in striking A-line dress
item.description: The royal, 48, donned a face mask and striking lace A-line dress as she attended the inaugural theatre opening for the 2020/21 season with her husband in the Spanish capital.

item.title: Holliday Grainger cradles her bump as she prepares to move out of London flat
item.description: Moving house can be a stressful ordeal, especially when carrying a precious cargo. But Holliday Grainger appeared to take setting up a new family home in her stride, even with a baby bump.

item.title: Is Boris about to make Charles Moore - a pro-hunting, anti-licence fee Brexiteer - new BBC chairman?
item.description: The Mail on Sunday understands the former editor of The Daily Telegraph and The Spectator, is Downing Street's favoured choice to take over at the Corporation.

item.title: Sir Simon Stevens is poised to step down as NHS chief executive
item.description: Sir Simon is understood to be in discussions about leaving his position as the chief executive of NHS England early next year.

item.title: Parents place children on risky exclusion diets due to mistaken belief they could beat allergies
item.description: Researchers blame bogus allergy tests that claim childhood eczema and asthma can be beaten by avoiding foods such as tomatoes, strawberries and milk.

item.title: JEREMY HUNT: It's crazy that six people can meet in a pub while mums endure lone births
item.description: JEREMY HUNT: Imagine the agony of a new mum sent for a scan on her own, only to be told that her much longed-for baby has no heartbeat.

item.title: Breast-feeding councillor at the centre of discrimination row after she was 'banned' from a meeting
item.description: Louise Rea was allegedly told that she could not bring her eight-month-old daughter Alice to the meeting for the Ivybridge town council in Devon amid fears over confidentiality.

item.title: HEALTH NOTES: This'll shake you... too LITTLE salt can be bad for us
item.description: Doctors at the Royal Free Hospital in London found that too little salt in the body, over a long period of time, weakens the immune system, increasing the risk of infections.

item.title: Robot and 14 surgeons work on a single cancer patient
item.description: The astonishing procedure, involving 14 surgeons, was carried out in Norfolk in July on a married father-of-one with advanced rectal cancer.

item.title: Tragic Lotto winner Colin Weir's spending spree of £40million is laid out in his will
item.description: Colin Weir was the UK's biggest lottery winner when he scooped the £161million jackpot with his now ex-wife Christine in 2011. When he died, aged 71, in December he spent half his £80m share.

item.title: Detective who found serial killer Dennis Nilsen's victims believes murderer got away with others
item.description: Hywel Jones, now 59, who was part of the investigative team who sifted through the suspect's garden in London in the 1980s, believes there are other unreported victims.

item.title: DR ELLIE CANNON: Can anything cure my sore and swollen legs?
item.description: DR ELLIE CANNON: Cellulitis is a relatively common infection of the skin and the underlying tissues which causes swelling, redness, heat and pain.

item.title: Killer lung infection that lurks in your compost
item.description: The illness - called invasive aspergillosis - develops when tiny particles of a common fungus are inhaled into the lungs, causing an infection.

item.title: Meet Maria… Meghan's style muse: Fashionista who planned the Duchess of Sussex's outfits
item.description: Maria Means Cote worked as a celebrity relations manager and counts a number of high-end designers as good friends.

item.title: Are corona passports really the magic bullet Ministers hope they'll be?
item.description: Corona cases are said to be doubling every week, hospital admissions are creeping up, and on Friday the mothballed Nightingale hospitals were put back on standby.

item.title: Quite a catch: Home that comes with permission to fish the River Tweed - for free!
item.description: One of the best-positioned country houses for fishing must be Benrig, in the Scottish Borders on the banks of the Tweed - famous for its trout and salmon.

item.title: Youngsters barred from seeing their parents amid chaos over Covid restrictions in care homes
item.description: A once-cheerful 35-year-old woman with a learning disability was physically held down by care home staff in the UK - after reaching for her mother's hand.

item.title: SIR DAVID ATTENBOROUGH sets out how mankind can pull off a miracle and save our planet
item.description: SIR DAVID ATTENBOROUGH: Just like the people who lived by the doomed nuclear reactor at Chernobyl, we are on the verge of destruction.

item.title: Jeremy Vine shocked after students at Durham University stop presses at his old college newspaper
item.description: The students' union claims it is shutting down the presses on the Palatinate newspaper to save money but many at the prestigious university believe the decision is politically motivated.

item.title: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: How a brazen fox wrecked my holiday... and my skin
item.description: ALEXANDRA SHULMAN: I sat down exactly where the fox had been, ignoring the few tufts of its hair, to watch my programme - and then the itching began on my bottom all of four minutes later.

item.title: Murder investigation launched in Liverpool as man is stabbed to death in broad daylight
item.description: Police detained a man in his 20s for questioning after a 30-year-old man was stabbed to death in the residential Liverpool suburb of Dingle this afternoon.

item.title: Why fit, healthy women are the most at risk of long Covid
item.description: One patient who has been unable to shake off coronavirus is wellness coach and voice-over artist Jeannie McGinnis, 48, from Sheffield.

item.title: Exclusive for Mail on Sunday readers: A Bordeaux cruise with chef James Martin to discover his roots
item.description: On this eight-day luxury river cruise along the Garonne, Dordogne and Gironde, you'll experience the region's full flavour - with one of the UK's most popular chefs, James Martin.

item.title: Secret Service intercepts package to Trump containing deadly poison RICIN
item.description: A package containing the poison ricin and addressed to President Donald Trump was intercepted by law enforcement earlier this week, two law enforcement officials told CNN.

item.title: Ex-Labour minister Geoffrey Robinson hands back thousands of pounds he was paid 'in error'
item.description: Former Labour Minister Geoffrey Robinson has handed back Commons expenses cash that he was paid 'in error'. He said the matter was now 'concluded'.

item.title: From banoffee pancakes to breakfast pizza, the UK's best brunch spots revealed by Richard Mellor
item.description: Here The Mail on Sunday's Richard Mellor - author of Foodie Breaks: England, Scotland, Northern Ireland and Wales - reveals his pick of Britain's brunch spots.

item.title: Great British boltholes: A review of Hillside Ventnor, Isle of Wight
item.description: The Mail on Sunday's Jane Knight checked into Hillside in the quirky resort of Ventnor on the Isle of Wight's south coast. Eight of the rooms have sea views and food is locally sourced.

item.title: Exploring a mesmerising £40m centre dedicated to Plymouth's glorious seafaring past
item.description: An exhibition to mark the 400th anniversary of the Mayflower's historic voyage opens next week at Plymouth's new cultural and heritage complex. Sarah Hartley went to check it out.

item.title: Hotel rooms with mini-kitchens are the perfect fix for a safer staycation
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: hotel rooms with kitchens for a safer staycation.

item.title: Alexei Navalny back up and walking after treatment for nerve agent poisoning at Berlin hospital
item.description: Alexei Navalny shared an update about his recovery in Berlin from novichok nerve agent poisoning. He is now able to walk unassisted after being taken off a ventilator earlier in the week.

item.title: Casino boss: 10pm curfew will hit night-time industries
item.description: Simon Thomas, chief of the Hippodrome in London's West End, said casinos make half their revenue after 10pm, and a national curfew would force him to make 'substantial redundancies'.

item.title: Princess Eugenie dons a face mask and sunglasses as she shops in west London
item.description: The royal, 30, donned a patterned face mask and round sunglasses as she wondered around the west London streets. She wore a black floral dress and white Stan Smith trainers.

item.title: Hounslow thriving due to ten bank branches
item.description: Banks claim branches are increasingly redundant. But the queues outside Hounslow's branches reveals what is lost when face-to-face contact is snatched away.

item.title: British mother who fought Sharia courts in Dubai to see her son faces losing her home
item.description: Afsana Lachaux, 52, has spent eight years battling for custody of Louis, her youngest child, after the Emirate state granted a divorce and branded her an unfit mother.

item.title: Trump says he is obligated to nominate a replacement for RBG without delay
item.description: President Donald Trump has signaled that he will nominate a replacement for Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg 'without delay', setting up an extraordinary confirmation battle.

item.title: Meghan Markle calls RBG the Justice of Courage as she pays tribute to the SCOTUS icon
item.description: 'With an incomparable and indelible legacy, Ruth Bader Ginsburg will forever be known as a woman of brilliance, a Justice of courage, and a human of deep conviction,' Markle said.

item.title: Riot police arrest hundreds of women in Belarusian capital Minsk during 'Sparkly March' protest
item.description: Around two thousand women took part in the protest in Minsk, Belarus, demanding an end to President Alexander Lukashenko's rule following the August 9 presidential election.

item.title: Bridezilla is slammed for offering wedding guests better food depending on cash gifts
item.description: A bride-to-be has been slammed on social media after she offered her wedding guests better meals using a four-tiered gift system based on the size of their cash gifts.

item.title: Renters betrayed as new evictions approach after housing secretary 'tears up his pledge'
item.description: Robert Jenrick introduced a ban on evictions at the start of the Covid pandemic which halted all hearings of possession cases in England. But this is set to be lifted from Monday.

item.title: Scientists warn Covid cases in UK will soon mirror those in Spain
item.description: The Joint Biosecurity Centre warned that Britain is now six weeks behind Spain, which reported 239 deaths on Wednesday and an average of more than 10,000 new cases per day in the last week.

item.title: Met Police buys 5,000 pairs of uniform trousers in XL size or higher for bigger officers
item.description: The Metropolitan Police ordered 5,000 pairs of uniform trousers in sizes XL or larger for their officers last year. Health experts say a person's waist should be no larger than half their height.

item.title: Carlisle hosts 1,000 fans for first English Football League match since outbreak began
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Crowds have returned to professional football in England today as Carlisle allowed 1,000 home fans to attend the match against Southend United

item.title: Axeman jailed for four years after inflicting 'worst example of grievous bodily harm' judge had seen
item.description: Leon Green had been at a pub in Chard, Somerset, with victim Joseph Guppy before going back to the other man's home and launching the vicious attack. He has now been jailed for four years.

item.title: Scientists claim third of UK covid-19 victims in July and August died from other causes
item.description: Scientists at Oxford University claim that one third of UK's Covid-19 deaths in July and August may have being due to other factors such as cancer or being hit by a car.

item.title: Police probe Land Rover driver who ploughed through park duck pond in front of members of public
item.description: The Land Rover drives through the duck pond at The Green in Norton, County Durham as the person taking the video says they are 'going to chase some ducks'.

item.title: Prince Frederik and Princess Mary met 20 years ago at the Slip Inn during the 2000 Sydney Olympics
item.description: In a packed city pub where hundreds stood transfixed by Australia's historic victory in the men's freestyle relay at the 2000 Sydney Olympics, two strangers only had eyes for each other.

item.title: Working from home is BAD for business: Bosses accuse WFH staff of skiving off
item.description: UK business leaders fear that working from home could dampen productivity and lead to increased feelings of loneliness as Britain teeters on the brink of a second lockdown.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson shares childhood snap to pay tribute to her mum Susan Barrantes on death anniversary
item.description: The Duchess of York, 60, who has been staying at Royal Lodge in Windsor since the beginning of lockdown, posted the adorable family shot of the red-haired sisters in Scotland.

item.title: Seek-and-find puzzle challenges you to count all the bees
item.description: Viral cartoonist Gergely Dudas, from Hungary, better known as Dudolf, challenged his fans to count the number of bees in this vibrant field of flowers.

item.title: Student, 20 with natural 34J breasts is crowdfunding for £5,000 surgery to reduce them to D-cup
item.description: Amber Roach, 20, from Watford, Hertfordshire, said she struggles to get out of bed, get on buses or play sport because of her 34J breasts. The 5ft 3in 9st law student's breasts way more than 1st.

item.title: Police set up tent in garden of Steven Clark's parents after pair were arrested
item.description: Detectives from the Cleveland and North Yorkshire Cold Case Unit reopened Steven's case after conducting an investigation into his disappearance.

item.title: Ocado warns it's running out of delivery slots as second lockdown looms over Britain
item.description: The online UK supermarkets pasted notices on their 'pick a slot' page warning customers the sites were experiencing high demand.

item.title: Senior SAGE advisor hits back at Dido Harding after she blamed group for not predicting second wave
item.description: Sir Jeremy Farrar has hit back at Dido Harding's claims that SAGE is to blame for testing chaos that gripped Britain in recent weeks. Mr Farrar said the board 'clear' in its advice to Government.

item.title: Boris and Starmer are tied in opinion polls - as 38% think Starmer looks like a PM-in-waiting
item.description: Labour and Conservatives level in YouGov poll as both gain 40%. Many asked feel that the Labour leader is also a future Prime Minister. Almost half of those polled fear Labour handling Brexit

item.title: 'Knife fanatic', 17, jailed for life for stabbing autistic best friend to death with a kitchen knife
item.description: Trent Hutchinson been jailed for life for stabbing his autistic best friend Ollie Wells to death with a kitchen knife during a row outside his mothers home in Newhaven, Sussex, on January 6 this year.

item.title: Britain's second wave takes hold with 4,422 cases in past 24 hours
item.description: This week 4,422 people tested positive for coronavirus and the total number of confirmed cases in the UK stands at 390,358.

item.title: Thug, 41, admits hacking estranged wife, 31, to death with a Gurkha-style MACHETE
item.description: Craig Woodhall, 41, plead guilty to stabbing his estranged wife Victoria in Barnsley on March 29 2020. On September 18 he admitted stabbing the 31-year-old multiple times with a machete.

item.title: Chilling moment convicted paedophile killer confesses to 'shredding to death' two underage girls
item.description: Vitaly Molchanov, 41, was detained by heavily-armed special forces in Rybinsk after he raped Elena and Nana Saprunova, eight and 13, and 'shredded' them with a knife.

item.title: Prince Charles of Luxembourg looks adorable at his christening
item.description: Born on May 10, the Prince, who is the son of Prince Guillaume, 38, and Princess Stéphanie of Luxembourg, 36, wears a traditional Christening gown today.

item.title: Woman injured when she fell from a moving car onto the M25 as she tried to capture Snapchat video
item.description: A woman suffered minor injuries when she fell from a moving car onto the M25 as she tried to take a Snapchat video. The incident took place between junction six and the Clacket Lane Services

item.title: Newborn died in parents' arms after hospital turned mother, 25, away three times
item.description: Adele Thomas, 25, was refused from the birth centre in Ystrad Mynach, Caerphilly, three times in July 2018 as it was claimed she wasn't in sufficient pain or dilated enough.

item.title: Mother-of-three who died from alcohol poisoning found on the loo with empty wine bottle at Pontin's
item.description: A mother-of-three who died of alcohol poisoning was found on the loo with an empty bottle of wine. Sioned Catherine Evans was on holiday with some of her family in a Pontin's chalet near Prestayn

item.title: Look out below! 250 British paratroopers jump into Ukraine in joint exercise with its army
item.description: Some 250 soldiers from Colchester-based 16 Air Assault Brigade dropped into the Ternivsky training area and teamed up with Ukrainian troops as conflict continues in the Eastern European country.

item.title: Schoolgirl, 17, FAKED brain tumour to con pop stars and their fans out of up to £400,000
item.description: Meghan Bhari founded Believe in Magic, backed by One Direction star Louis Tomlinson, to help 'other' terminally ill children in 2012 before she died in 2018 at age 23.

item.title: 'The BBC trust me': Gary Lineker denies being told to censor his social media
item.description: Gary Lineker, 59, has denied ever being told to stop political tweeting by BBC chief Tim Davie - who is planning a radical shake-up of the UK's broadcaster.

item.title: Rapist, 21, who attacked woman then tried to blame an imaginary IDENTICAL TWIN jailed for 22 years
item.description: Khaled Argoub, 21, was sentenced to 22 years at Kingston Crown Court on 17 September after being found guilty of two counts of attempted rape and three counts of sexual assault.

item.title: British celebrity chef who worked for Jeffrey Epstein for four years is 'fully cooperating' with FBI
item.description: Adam Perry Lang, 51, opened the Barbecoa restaurant with Jamie Oliver in London in 2010 - and worked for Jeffrey Epstein between 1999 and 2003.

item.title: Classic 1977 Norton Commando still in its original shipping crate to be auctioned
item.description: The Norton Commando is already a highly-collectible vintage motorbike, but this 1977 example is unique as it's never been unpacked after being shipped from the UK to a customer in Belgium 43 years ago.

item.title: 'Clear evidence' for rising Covid cases in children, ONS data shows
item.description: Covid-19 cases in children are seven times higher than they were in July, the Office for National Statistics has claimed, while warning levels were rising in under 30s.

item.title: Prince Harry has 'joined a helicopter club in California' so he can take Meghan and Archie on trips
item.description: The Duke of Sussex, 36, needs to practice flying in Santa Barabra in order to to keep his helicopter licence current, a royal insider told the Sun .

item.title: Ex-MI6 agent, 73, probed over claims he gave information to Beijing
item.description: Fraser Cameron, 73, said the allegations towards him were 'ridiculous' because he has 'zero access to any secret or confidential information'.

item.title: Sacked chief-executive, 60, posts a video of himself doing press-ups to show
item.description: Paul Marks from Poulton-le-Fylde in Lancashire, believes he had missed out on more than fifty jobs before the video of him doing six press-ups in his suit made him a viral success.

item.title: Ugg boots sales are up 29 per cent as noughties trend gets a 2020 reboot
item.description: Emily Ratajkowski and Joan Smalls have recently been spotted in the £145 Ugg minis in New York., While Sienna Miller, Gigi Hadid, Sarah Jessica Parker and Rihanna are also long term fans.

item.title: Delivery driver proposes to girlfriend by getting 'will you marry me?' inked on his chest
item.description: Smitten Bruno Neves, 33, wanted to ask his partner Patricia Calado, 34, to marry him after a trip to his favourite tattoo parlour in Great Yarmouth, Norfolk.

item.title: London for under £100 a night? That's capital - and you can even snag yourself a boutique hotel
item.description: London is different at the moment. The hordes are staying away and you can find plenty of decent places to stay for less than £100 a night. Here's our guide on how you can save on your hotel room.

item.title: The Secret Garden classic has been remade and can explore the stunning film locations
item.description: The latest film version of The Secret Garden - with Colin Firth and Julie Walters - used some of Britain's idyllic locations to create a magical world. And you can visit them, too...

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on… Sasha Swire's political diary
item.description: PAUL THOMAS on… Sasha Swire's political diary: 'We've lost enough friends already, Sasha - I wish we COULD go back into lockdown'

item.title: Violent drug dealer who absconded from an open prison 'tries to hand himself in SEVEN times'
item.description: A violent drug dealer, Akram Uddin, 27, who absconded from an open prison tried to hand himself in seven times - but was repeatedly turned away, a court heard yesterday.

item.title: Daredevil climber without any safety equipment climbs up the tallest skyscraper in central Paris
item.description: A climber without any safety equipment tonight used his bare hands to climb up the tallest skyscraper in central Paris - before being arrested at the top by police officers

item.title: Devastated father, 45, loses son and his wife in the space of six months
item.description: Chris Kelly and his partner Kim Clarke, from Liverpool, lost their son Nick in March this year, to a suspected allergic reaction. Kim passed away on Sunday 13 following a sudden brain bleed.
